intro: Senecio racemosus, commonly known as the African snowball, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a straight, branching stem covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated margin. Senecio racemosus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil and full sun.
